extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • robotInfo

        public java.lang.String robotInfo(char c)
        Run by user to get robot information. Only used in this class, and will always run exportrobot.
        Parameters:
        c - Character to split robot info by.
        Returns:
        robot information

      • exportRobot

        protected java.lang.String exportRobot(char c)
        Returns data for a robot, there are multiple overloads of this function.
        Parameters:
        c - character to split by
        Returns:
        robot data

      • separate

        protected java.lang.String separate(char c,
                                    java.lang.Object... data)
        Separate robot data by C
        Parameters:
        c - separate by this character
        data - robot data
        Returns:
        any number of objects, in string form, separated by char c

      • setColor

        protected void setColor(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        Sets the color depending on if the robot is active
        Parameters:
        gc - Graphics Context which the robot is drawn to

      • Left

        public boolean Left(double x,
                    double y,
                    double size)
        Most robots have no need for a Left Right function, as they do not have whiskers, but if it gets called, then they will return false
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the bump point
        y - y coordinate of the bump point
        size - the size of the light or object which needs to be checked
        Returns:
        false

      • Right

        public boolean Right(double x,
                     double y,
                     double size)
        Most robots have no need for a Left Right function, as they do not have whiskers, but if it gets called, then they will return false
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the bump point
        y - y coordinate of the bump point
        size - the size of the light or object which needs to be checked
        Returns:
        false

      • Calculate

        public void Calculate()
        Update the location of the robot, based on its speed and direction. Also, conservation of momentum rules apply here.

      • fixangle

        protected double fixangle(double angle)
        Keeps angles between 0 and 360, should be used with setAngle();
        Parameters:
        angle - angle to be fixed
        Returns:
        fixed angle

      • cos

        protected double cos(double angle)
        short math.cos function
        Parameters:
        angle - angle
        Returns:
        cos angle

        protected double sin(double angle)
        short math.sin function
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        sin angle

      • OnWallBounce

        public void OnWallBounce(double canvaswidth,
                         double canvasheight)
        Bounce on wall
        Parameters:
        canvaswidth - 0 to right wall
        canvasheight - 0 to bottom wall

      • Collide

        public void Collide(double reflectionaxis)
        If robots collide, make them bounce off eachother using reflection axis.
        Parameters:
        reflectionaxis - the angle at which they collide

      • getBrightness

        public double getBrightness()
        Robots do not have a brightness generally
        Returns:
        0 for generic robots
